TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PagerSettings extends System.Object implements class System.Web.UI.IStateManager

Docs.summary: Represents the properties of the paging controls in a control that supports pagination. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Controls that support pagination (such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> controls) can display a set of controls called *the pager* that allows the user to navigate the pages within the control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> class is used by these controls to represent the properties of the pager. In general, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object is stored in the `PagerSettings` property of the control. You can customize the pager by setting the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object.
The pager supports several different display modes. To specify the mode in which to display the pager, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property. The following table describes the different modes.
|Mode|Description| |----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious>|Previous-page and next-page buttons.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast>|Previous-page, next-page, first-page, and last -page buttons.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.Numeric>|Numbered link buttons to access pages directly.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast>|Numbered-link, first-link, and last-link buttons.|
When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value you can customize the text of the non-numeric buttons by setting the properties shown in the following table.
|Property|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A>|Text for the first-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageText%2A>|Text for the previous-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A>|Text for the next-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A>|Text for the last-page button.|
As an alternative, you can also display images for the non-numeric buttons by setting the properties as shown in the following table.
|Property|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A>|The URL to an image to display for the first-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageImageUrl%2A>|The URL to an image to display for the previous-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A>|The URL to an image to display for the next-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageImageUrl%2A>|The URL to an image to display for the last-page button.|
> [!NOTE] > When an image property is set, the corresponding text property acts as the alternate text for the image. For example, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property is set, the text that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property is displayed as the alternate text for the image. On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.Numeric> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, you can specify the number of page buttons to display in the pager by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PageButtonCount%2A> property.
The pager can be displayed at the top, the bottom, or both the top and bottom of a control. To specify the position of the pager, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Position%2A> property. To show or hide the pager, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Visible%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object that is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.PagerSettings%2A> property to customize the text of the buttons that are displayed in the pager row of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[PagerSettingsText#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PagerSettingsText/CS/PagerSettingsTextcs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[PagerSettingsText#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PagerSettingsText/VB/PagerSettingsTextvb.aspx#1)] -->

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> class.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.%23ctor%2A> constructor generally is used by control developers when providing paging support in a custom control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL to an image to display for the first-page button.
Docs.value: The URL to an image to display for the first-page button. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to an image to display for the first-page button.
> [!NOTE] > As an alternative, you can display text for the first-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image. On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property to display an image for the first-page button in the pager row of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[PagerSettingsImages#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PagerSettingsImages/CS/PagerSettingsImagescs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[PagerSettingsImages#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PagerSettingsImages/VB/PagerSettingsImagesvb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text to display for the first-page button.
Docs.value: The text to display for the first-page button. The default is "<<", which renders as "<<".

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property to specify the text to display for the first-page button.
> [!NOTE] > As an alternative, you can display an image for the first-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image. On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property to customize the text that is displayed for the first-page button of the pager row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL to an image to display for the last-page button.
Docs.value: The URL to an image to display for the last-page button. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to an image to display for the last-page button.
> [!NOTE] > As an alternative, you can simply display text for the last-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageImageUrl%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image. On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the mode in which to display the pager controls in a control that supports pagination.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Controls that support pagination provide multiple modes in which to display the paging controls. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property to specify the mode. The following table describes the different modes for pagination controls.
|Mode|Description| |----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious>|Previous-page and next-page buttons.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast>|Previous-page, next-page, first-page, and last-page buttons.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.Numeric>|Numbered link buttons to access pages directly.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast>|Numbered and first-link and last-link buttons.|
When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, you can specify custom text for the non-numeric buttons by setting the properties shown in the following table.
|Property|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A>|Text for the first-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageText%2A>|Text for the previous-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A>|Text for the next-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A>|Text for the last-page button.|
As an alternative, you can also display images for the non-numeric buttons by setting the properties shown in the following table.
|Property|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A>|The URL to an image to display for the first-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageImageUrl%2A>|The URL to an image to display for the previous-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A>|The URL to an image to display for the next-page button.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageImageUrl%2A>|The URL to an image to display for the last-page button.|
> [!NOTE] > When an image property is set, the corresponding text property acts as the alternate text for the image. For example, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property is set, the text that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property is displayed as the alternate text for the image. On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property to specify that the pager row for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control should display numeric buttons.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[PagerSettingsNumeric#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PagerSettingsNumeric/CS/PagerSettingsNumericcs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[PagerSettingsNumeric#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PagerSettingsNumeric/VB/PagerSettingsNumericvb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL to an image to display for the next-page button.
Docs.value: The URL to an image to display for the next-page button. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to an image to display for the next-page button.
> [!NOTE] > As an alternative, you can simply display text for the next-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image. On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A> property to display an image for the next-page button in the pager row of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text to display for the next-page button.
Docs.value: The text to display for the next-page button. The default is ">", which renders as ">".

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> property to specify the text to display for the next-page button.
> [!NOTE] > As an alternative, you can display an image for the next-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image. On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> property to customize the text that is displayed for the next-page button of the pager row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of page buttons to display in the pager when the property is set to the or value.
Docs.value: The number of page buttons to display in the pager. The default is 10.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.Numeric> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PageButtonCount%2A> property to specify the number of page buttons to display in the pager.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PageButtonCount%2A> property to display five page buttons at a time in the pager row of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the location where the pager is displayed.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Position%2A> property to specify the location at which to display the pager. The following table describes the different positions.
|Position|Location| |--------------|--------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerPosition.Bottom>|The bottom of the control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerPosition.Top>|The top of the control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerPosition.TopAndBottom>|At both the top and bottom of the control.|
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Position%2A> property to display the pager row at the bottom of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.

Docs.value: The text to display for the previous page button. The default is "<", which renders as "<".

## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageText%2A> property to specify the text to display for the previous-page button.

The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageText%2A> property to customize the text that is displayed for the previous-page button of the pager row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[PagerSettingsText#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PagerSettingsText/CS/PagerSettingsTextcs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[PagerSettingsText#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PagerSettingsText/VB/PagerSettingsTextvb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Occurs when a property of a object changes values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PropertyChanged> event is raised each time a property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object changes values. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PropertyChanged> event commonly is used by data-bound controls that support pagination to rebind the data to the control when the pager settings change.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the server control is tracking its view state changes.
Docs.value: if the data source view is marked to save its state; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState(object state) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that represents the state of the .
Docs.summary: Loads the previously saved view state of the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23LoadViewState%2A> method to load the previously saved view state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23LoadViewState%2A> method is private and cannot be called.

Docs.summary: Saves the current view state of the object.
Docs.returns: An object that contains the saved state of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23SaveViewState%2A> method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> class to save the state of the object.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23SaveViewState%2A> method is private and cannot be called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Marks the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving view state changes to the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23TrackViewState%2A> method is overridden to mark the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object as part of the view state for the object.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23TrackViewState%2A> method is private and cannot be called.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the string representation of a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.ToString%2A> method is used to retrieve a string representation of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.ToString%2A> method has been overridden to always return an empty string.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the paging controls are displayed in a control that supports pagination.
Docs.value: to display the pager; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Visible%2A> property to specify whether the paging controls are displayed in a control that supports pagination. To hide the paging controls, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Visible%2A> property to `false`.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Visible%2A> property to hide the pager row when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control is in edit mode.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[PagerSettingsVisible#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PagerSettingsVisible/CS/PagerSettingsVisiblecs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[PagerSettingsVisible#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PagerSettingsVisible/VB/PagerSettingsVisiblevb.aspx#1)] -->
